title: The Arch with a Shell Ornament. A Series of Galleries with Round Arches  and a Crane-Like Erection of Beams in the Right Foreground
medium: etching, engraving, scratching, sulphur tint or open bite, drypoint on paper
provenance_text:
Possibly Frederick Keppel & Co., Inc., New York, NY [1]. Possibly sold to Kenneth Seaver [1877-1969], on February 25, 1928 [1]; Kenneth Seaver, Pittsburgh, PA and Oakmont, PA, until December 8, 1948; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1948. 

Notes:
[1]. See original invoice from Frederick Keppel & Co in curatorial file. However, Kenneth Seaver donated to the Museum two such prints (second edition, first and third issue), 47.11.26 and 48.22.11. The existing invoice is not detailed enough to identify which of these was acquired from this source on this date.
